$comment: For more information about the Snicco Fortress Security Plugin refer to [the documentation](https://github.com/fortress-docs).

modules.description: Determines the actively used modules of Fortress.

url_namespace.description: The shared prefix of all routes that Fortress manages.

cli_namespace.description: The namespace used for WP-CLI commands. Must be valid according to the WP-CLI command name rules.

challenges_table_name.description: The table name (without prefix) where Fortress stores auth challenges.

privileged_user_roles.description: An array of WordPress user roles that Fortress considers to be privileged.

theme_css_file.description: A path to an existing CSS file that defines CSS variables to customize the frontend appearance of Fortress. Relative to the domain.

sudo_mode_timeout.description: The interval in seconds during which Fortress will consider a session to be in sudo mode after logging in.

sudo_mode_timeout_per_cap.description: An object that can be used to specify sudo mode timeouts for users with specific capabilities.

idle_timeout.description: The interval in seconds after which a user without activity is logged out.

idle_timeout_per_cap.description: An object that can be used to specify idle timeouts for users with specific capabilities.

rotation_timeout.description: The interval after which the user's session token is rotated.

rotation_timeout_per_cap.description: An object that can be used to specify rotation timeouts for users with specific capabilities.

absolute_timeout.description: The maximum lifespan of a user session, applicable only to users that did not check the 'remember me' option during login.

absolute_timeout_per_cap.description: An object that can be used to specify absolute timeouts for users with specific capabilities, applicable only to users that did not check the 'remember me' option during login.

absolute_timeout_remembered_user.description: The maximum lifespan of a user session, applicable only to users that checked the 'remember me' option during login.

absolute_timeout_remembered_user_per_cap.description: An object that can be used to specify absolute timeouts for users with specific capabilities, applicable only to users that checked the 'remember me' option during login.

session_table_name.description: The name without the prefix of the database table that stores user sessions.

remember_cookie_name.description: Determines the name of a marker cookie that Fortress uses to determine if a user wants to be remembered.

protected_pages.description: The protected_pages option specifies URL paths that a user can only access if his session is still in sudo mode. You can use a * character as a wildcard.

totp_secrets_table_name.description: The name of the database table that stores users' TOTP secrets.

totp_sha_algo.description: The hash algorithm used to generate six-digit one-time passwords for TOTP.

skip_2fa_setup_duration_seconds.description: The interval in seconds a user can skip his mandatory 2FA setup once.

require_2fa_for_roles.description: Roles that require 2FA immediately after login. This default to the value of 'privileged_user_roles'

require_2fa_for_roles_before_login.description: Roles that require confirmed 2FA credentials before login.

max_totp_attempts_before_lockout.description: The maximum amount of failed 2FA attempts allowed before locking an account.

password_policy_excluded_roles.description: An array of user roles that are excluded from complying with the password policy.

disable_application_passwords.description: Controls whether WordPress application passwords are entirely disabled.

allow_legacy_hashes.description: Controls whether Fortress will try to validate password hashes created using the insecure default hashing algorithm of WordPress.

default_hash_strength.description: Determines how long it takes the libsodium PHP extension to compute the hash of a password.

auto_upgrade_hashes.description: Controls whether Fortress will automatically rehash a user's password after he entered authenticated successfully.

include_pluggable_functions.description: Whether Fortress should load its custom implementations of the 'wp_***' pluggable password functions.

disable_web_password_reset_for_roles.description: An array of WordPress user roles for which password resets in the admin and frontend UI are disabled. Defaults to the value of 'privileged_user_roles'

storage.description: The storage option can be used to explicitly tell Fortress to use the database as a rate-limit storage.

cache_group.description: The cache_group option will either be used as a WP Object cache group for storing rate limits or, if no object cache is available, as the database table name for storing rate limits.

device_id_cookie_prefix.description: All device ID cookies will start with the value of the device_id option.

device_id_burst.description: The number of failed login attempts a user can make with a valid device ID before the device ID throttling activates.

device_id_refill_one_token_seconds.description: The interval in seconds a user rate-limited by his device ID has to wait before he can make ONE more login request.

username_burst.description: The number of failed login attempts a user can make without device ID before the username throttling activates.

username_refill_one_token_seconds.description: The interval in seconds that a user rate-limited by his username has to wait before he can make ONE more login request for that same username.

ip_burst.description: The number of failed login attempts that one IP address can make before the IP throttling activates.

ip_refill_one_token_seconds.description: The interval in seconds that a rate-limited IP address has to wait before it can make ONE more login request.

global_burst.description: The number of failed logins that are considered 'normal' across the entire site. Exceeding this limit will activate the global login throttling.

global_refill_one_token_seconds.description: The interval in seconds after which ONE more login request is possible globally.

log_to_syslog.description: Whether failed login requests during active rate-limiting should be logged to the syslog

syslog_daemon.description: The syslog_deamon option will be prepended to all messages that Fortress logs to the syslog.

syslog_flags.description: A bitmask, valid options can be found in the openlog manual. Defaults to LOG_PID

syslog_facility.description: A bitmask, valid options can be found in the openlog manual. Defaults to LOG_AUTH
